channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Yellow Day
item.description:
Sunday, 16 November 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Yellow to support Yellow Day

Bully Zero is a key actionist driving awareness for Yellow Day – the International Stand Up to Bullying Day. As part of this day, a global organisation will be donating $10 for every photo that is shared of yellow day activities with the hashtag #rideoutintimidation. To learn more visit: brpyellowday.com

This Light Up is organised by: Bully Zero Australia Foundation

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: World Prematurity Day
item.description:
Monday, 17 November 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support World Prematurity Day

World Prematurity Day takes place on 17 November each year. The day raises awareness of the nearly 15 million babies born premature each year worldwide (one every 2 seconds) and the nearly 1 m babies who lose their fight to survive. It also raises awareness of the need to do more to prevent preterm birth. Landmarks around Australia and the World are lit purple to raise awareness of the plight of these babies and to honour their struggles to survive. It also helps to raise awareness of and fund charities like PIPA

This Light Up is organised by: PIPA (Preterm Infants Parents Association)

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Proclamation Day of the Republic of Latvia
item.description:
Tuesday, 18 November 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Maroon and White to celebrate the Proclamation Day of the Republic of Latvia

Proclamation Day of the Republic of Latvia, held annually on 18 November, marks Latvia’s declaration of independence in 1918. It is a celebration of Latvia’s independence and raises awareness of Latvian heritage within the wider community. We aim to honour this significant national day, express pride in our cultural identity, and visibly connect the Latvian community in Brisbane with similar celebrations held around the world.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Latvian Association

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Eve of World Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Day
item.description:
Wednesday, 19 November 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support the Eve of World Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Day

World Pancreatic Cancer Day is held on the third Thursday of November each year, which falls on November 20, 2025. The day is part of Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Month and aims to raise public awareness about the disease, its risks and symptoms, and the importance of early detection, as well as to honour patients and survivors and support the research. Every November, we unite with communities across Australia to wear purple, turn landmarks purple, share stories, hold events, and elevate the voices of those impacted. It’s a time to honour lives, raise visibility, and demand greater focus on this devastating disease.
Join us this November to make pancreatic cancer impossible to ignore.

This Light Up is organised by: Pankind Australian Pancreatic Cancer Foundation Limited

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Transgender Day of Remembrance
item.description:
Thursday, 20 November 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue, White and Pink to support Transgender Day of Remembrance

Many Genders One Voice holds a Transgender Day of Remembrance ceremony every year, as part of other international events that occur during Transgender Awareness Week. This week aims to help raise the visibility of transgender, gender diverse and non-binary people, and address the issues the community faces. The final day of Transgender Awareness Week is Transgender Day of Remembrance (TDOR), an annual observance on November 20 that honours the memory of those whose lives were lost in acts of anti-transgender violence

This Light Up is organised by: Many Genders One Voice/ Qld Aids Council

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

This Light Up is organised by: Many Genders One Voice/ Qld Aids Council

item.title: National Ag Day
item.description:
Friday, 21 November 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Green to celebrate National Ag Day

National Agriculture Day is your chance to celebrate the fact, we are all a part of the same cycle, all moving in the same direction. Whether city or bush-based, Australians are all motivated to create a better future for our families and our environment. We all live in the same modern world and share the same progressive values.


This Light Up is organised by: AgForce Queensland Farmers Ltd

item.title: World Day for the Prevention of & Healing from Child Sexual Exploitation, Abuse & Violence
item.description:
Saturday, 22 November 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support World Day for the Prevention of & Healing from Child Sexual Exploitation, Abuse & Violence

UN invites the commemoration the World Day for the Prevention of and Healing from Child Sexual Exploitation, Abuse, and Violence each year in a manner that each considers most appropriate. This includes commitments to raise public awareness of those affected by child sexual abuse and the need to prevent and eliminate child sexual exploitation, abuse, and violence, including online and offline.

This Light Up is organised by: National Centre for Action on Child Sexual Abuse

item.title: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Sunday, 23 November 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support the Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal

The Lord Mayor’s Charitable Trust has been caring for the Brisbane community since the 1950s. Through a range of critical grant rounds, facilitating connections and support the to local and grassroots charities, The Trust makes an impact on Brisbane’s biggest community challenges and most vulnerable residents. The Trust exists to support the Brisbane’s frontline charities.
Every year, the Lord Mayor’s Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal raises much needed funds to spread some festive cheer to support the charities in Brisbane. In 2024, the Christmas Appeal allowed the Trust to present grants to 93 different charities, bringing joy to families desperately in need within our community. Your support the, no matter how big or small, you can make a genuine difference this festive season.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: National Asbestos Awareness Week
item.description:
Monday, 24 November – Tuesday, 25 November 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue to support National Asbestos Awareness Week

National Asbestos Awareness Week is held from Monday, 24 November 20225 to Sunday 30 November 2025 to raise awareness about asbestos related diseases, to remember the many thousands of people who have died as a result of an asbestos-related diseases, and to encourage Australians to protect themselves against exposure to asbestos-containing materials, particularly when doing home renovations.

This Light Up is organised by: Asbestos Disease Support Society

Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Australian PGA
item.description:
Wednesday, 26 November 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue and Green to celebrate the Australian PGA

The Australian PGA Championship is the PGA’s flagship event. A stellar field of Australian and International players will compete for the Joe Kirkwood Cup - Australian professional golf’s oldest trophy. This tournament is for the fans and will feature a range of experiences and precincts for golf fans, families, and party goers alike.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Zonta Says No to Violence against Women
item.description:
Thursday, 27 November 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Orange to support Zonta Says No to Violence against Women

Zonta Clubs of Brisbane and surrounding areas will paint the region orange in the lead-up to and during the 16 Days of Activism from 25 November (the United Nations Day for the Elimination of Violence Against Women) through to 10 December 2025 (the United Nations Day for Human Rights) to highlight the impact of domestic and family violence on women and children and our economy.

This Light Up is organised by: Zonta Club of Brisbane East Inc

item.title: Australian PGA - Yellow Day
item.description:
Friday, 28 November 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Yellow to celebrate the Australian PGA - Yellow Day

On the 28th of November, the Australian PGA Championship will be helping to raise much-needed funds for Challenge, a charity devoted to celebrate theing children and families living with cancer. Professionals and all involved in the tournament will be #DoingItForJarrod and wearing yellow in memory of Jarrod Lyle, an ambassador for Challenge and the ongoing dedication of this charity. #DoingitforJarrod

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Romania National Day
item.description:
Saturday, 29 November 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Red Yellow Blue to celebrate the Romania National Day

On 1 December the Romanian people celebrate the Great Union of Romania. This is when the country took the shape of a modern unified state and it is a symbol of great significance of unity and cultural, social and historical continuity.

This Light Up is organised by: Romanian Association Doina Queensland Inc

item.title: World AIDS Day
item.description:
Monday, 1 December 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support World AIDS Day

World AIDS Day is held on 1 December each year globally and raises awareness across the world and in the community about the issues surrounding HIV and AIDS. It is a day for people to show their support for people living with HIV and to commemorate people who have been lost to the epidemic here in Queensland, and further afield.
Queensland Positive People (QPP), is a peer-led, community-based organisation committed to improving the lives of all people living with HIV and help reduce new transmissions of HIV and other STIs across Queensland. With the support of Queensland Health, QPP delivers the World AIDS Day awareness campaign in Queensland, and supports the Queensland Council of LGBTI Health to deliver the vigils and remembrances in Brisbane and across Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Positive People Inc.

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

World AIDS Day is held on 1 December each year globally and raises awareness across the world and in the community about the issues surrounding HIV and AIDS. It is a day for people to show their support for people living with HIV and to commemorate people who have been lost to the epidemic here in Queensland, and further afield.
Queensland Positive People (QPP), is a peer-led, community-based organisation committed to improving the lives of all people living with HIV and help reduce new transmissions of HIV and other STIs across Queensland. With the support of Queensland Health, QPP delivers the World AIDS Day awareness campaign in Queensland, and supports the Queensland Council of LGBTI Health to deliver the vigils and remembrances in Brisbane and across Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Positive People Inc.

Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Youngcare Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Tuesday, 2 December 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Red to support Youngcare Christmas Appeal

Too many young people with complex physical disabilities are being left behind; living without the choice and equality that we all deserve. Youngcare is a national not-for-profit dedicated to ensuring all young people, regardless of their care needs can choose where they live, who they live with and how they live their lives. Youngcare is raising awareness and funds to achieve its mission, in the lead up to the International Day of Disabled Persons on 3rd of December, and further ahead to the Christmas Appeal.

This Light Up is organised by: YoungCare

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: 2025 International Day of People with Disability
item.description:
Wednesday, 3 December 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support 2025 International Day of People with Disability

International Day of People with Disability is held on 3 December each year, and is a United Nations observed day aimed at increasing public awareness, understanding and acceptance of people with disability.
It's a day to celebrate the achievements and contributions of people with disability.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

item.title: World Chromosome 18 Day
item.description:
Thursday, 4 December 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Purple Yellow Green Pink to support World Chromosome 18 Day

World Chromosome 18 Day raises awareness to help Chromosome 18 Australasia achieve its objectives. The day also celebrates individuals affected and their families and brings much happiness to each of them. Join Chromosome 18 families from around the World on Sunday 7 December, for World Chromosome 18 Day! This is a free, virtual event with Educational speakers, research updates, Syndrome breakouts and Self-Advocate sessions. But most of all, it is a chance to come together with our global chromosome 18 families to learn, connect, and have fun! Pre-Registration is required at www.chromosome18.org

This Light Up is organised by: Chromosone 18 Australasia

Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Ashes Test Cricket
item.description:
Friday, 5 December 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green and Gold to celebrate Ashes Test Cricket

The Gabba will host its first ever day/night Ashes Test as Australia and England return to Brisbane for the 2nd of the 2025/26 NRMA Insurance Men's Ashes Series.
The Ashes remains one of the most historic events in world sport, with intense rivalries, unforgettable moments and world-class cricket in the battle for the iconic urn.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Decvelopment Agency
